column1: Ancient Greek includes the forms of Greek used in ancient Greece and the ancient world from around the 9th century BCE to the 6th century CE. It is often roughly divided into the Archaic period (9th to 6th centuries BCE)
column3: and Hellenistic period (3rd century BCE to 6th century CE). It is antedated in the second millennium BCE by Mycenaean Greek.The language of the Hellenistic phase is known as Koine (common). Koine is regarded as a separate historical stage of its own
column4: although in its earliest form it closely resembled Attic Greek and in its latest form it approaches Medieval Greek. Prior to the Koine period
column5: Greek of the classic and earlier periods included several regional dialects.Ancient Greek was the language of Homer and of classical Athenian historians
column7: and philosophers. It has contributed many words to English vocabulary and has been a standard subject of study in educational institutions of the West since the Renaissance. This article primarily contains information about the Epic and Classical phases of the language.
